result.execSummary:
The defendant Harley R. Est was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Obtain and maintain employment, commensurate with her treatment needs.  Not to terminate her employment without her agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by her agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by her agent.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. 

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with the Arrowhead Lodge or it's employees, Heaven Beaman, Jennifer Hendricks, Cassandra Novak or Kyle Iverson.   Not to have any contact with any known drug users or dealers.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

records.addlTxt:
Assistant District Attorney, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.    The defendant appeared by video from Taycheedah Correctional Institution.  Attorney Linehan appeared in court.  Court confirmed that the defendant wishes to appear by video instead of in person.  Parties have an agreement as to days of credit.  391 days in 15CF18.  

Resentencing on 16CF10,  Count 2.  3 years initial confinement agreed to with 2 years extended supervision.  Defendant exercised her right to allocution.  Court ordered:  5 years total, bifurcated as 3 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.  Appeal rights given to the defendant on the record.
Review hearing on August 2, 2018 at 11:30 am.
Assistant District Attorney, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.  Attorney Linehan appeared in court.  Cannot get Taycheedah by VTC.  Need to reschedule the hearing.
routed to Judge

Transcript of Sentencing hearing on revocation held on 1/30/18

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Linehan.  Parties have the revocation packet.  Victim is present.   No changes or corrections.  Joint recommendation for:  17CF36.  5 years total.  Bifurcated as 3 years initial confinement  2 years extended supervision.  16CF10: 5 years total.  Bifurcated as 3 years  initial confinement  2 years extended supervision.  16CF109: 5 years total.  Bifurcated as 3 years  initial confinement  2 years extended supervision years.  On Count 2: 9 months county jail.  15CF18.  3-1/2 years total.  Bifurcated as 18 months initial confinement  24 months extended supervision.   All concurrent.  Eligible for CIP and SAP.  Victim made a statement.  Defense requests these cases run concurrent with Trempealeau County Case No. 17CF150.  Defendant did not exercise her right to allocution.  

Court ordered:  17CF36.  5 years total.  Bifurcated as 3 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.  16CF10: 6 years total.  Bifurcated as 4 years  initial confinement  and 2 years extended supervision.  16CF109: Count 1:  5 years total.  Bifurcated as 3 years  initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision years.  On Count 2: 9 months county jail.  15CF18.  3-1/2 years total.  Bifurcated as 18 months initial confinement and 24 months extended supervision.   All concurrent.  Consecutive to Trempealeau County Case No. 17CF150.  Eligible for CIP and SAP.  

ES conditions:   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.  AODA and recommended treatment.  Defendant to be subject to testing by her agent.  Obtain and maintain employment, commensurate with her treatment needs.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Obey no contact orders of her agent.  Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations on the SEHR cases.  CC.  

Sentence credit:  Attorney Linehan conceeded that the 9 months conditional jail served on 15CF18 does not apply towards her sentence credit, as she was not serving a sentence.   Defendant received 176 days credit towards that conditional jail at the time she was placed on probation.  Parties agree that the defendant is entitled to lines 10 through 12, on the Jackson County Sherff's report filed on 1/25/18,  plus additional days through today.  That pplies to 15CF18, 16CF10 and 16CF109,  for a total credit of 198 days.  On  case number 17CF36, the case was not filed until 2/24/17, so line 10 would not apply, so the credit on that case is 191 days.
Jail Credit, Revocation Order and Warrant
Letter to Judge Becker
SEHR rescheduled at request of Atty Linehan due to scheduling conflict; ok'd with DA's office.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Public defender order appointing counsel

Defendant plead no contest to counts 1 & 2 in 16CF109.  Count 2 in 16CF10.  15CF194, 16CF1, 15CF208 and remaining count in 16CF10 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court found defendant guilty of count 2 in 15CF18.   Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the counts she plead to.  Felony warnings given.  Priors confirmed by the court with the defendant and Attorney Sebion.    Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered her pleas and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of Felony Bail Jumping, contrary to 946.49(1)(b),  Attempt Deliver Meth. , contrary to 961.41(1)(e)1  and Resisting, contrary to 946.41(1) and Possession of Narcotic Drugs, contrary to 961.41(3g)(am). Joint recommendation for 5 years probation.  DNA  & surcharge.  AODA, and recommended treatment.  6-12 months conditional jail.  Obtain and maintain employment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  No contact Heaven Beaman or Jennifer Hendricks.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  

Court ordered:  sentence withheld,  5 years probation. 18 months probation on the resisting charge.  All concurrent.  CC.  DNA sample  & surcharge.  AODA, and recommended treatment.  9 months conditional jail, on count 2 in 15CF18.  Obtain and maintain employment, commensurate with her treatment needs.     Not to terminate without agent's prior approval.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  No contact Heaven Beaman or Jennifer Hendricks, Cassandra Novak, or Kyle Iverson.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.   Use only one pharmacy, and identify that pharmacy to your agent.  No contact with any known illegal drug users or dealers.  No contact with Arrowhead Lodge or employees.     Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Subject to random drug and alcohol testing.   Credit for 176 days on 15CF18 only.  Apply bond to court costs.
Information filed with the court.   Reading of the information waived.

She stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived her right to have a preliminary hearing.
